name: VMS / VAX Help Library
summary: Learn about .HLB files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: VMS/VAX systems were standard in the 1980s and 1990s, and Digital Equipment Corporation renamed VMS/VAX to OpenVMS in 1992. The system was eventually deprecated, making HLB files largely obscure. However, some organizations still use OpenVMS, and users needing technical assistance with OpenVMS may still access HLB files.

description: An HLB file is a help library used by the Virtual Memory System (VMS) operating system for Virtual Address eXtension (VAX) computers developed by Digital Equipment Corporation. It contains help documentation in a structured format that users can access via VMS/VAX system commands and then navigate to learn how to use various system features or software applications.

instructions: You can open HLB files with HP OpenVMS in Windows. Since HLB files store plain text information, you can also open them with a text editor, such as Microsoft Notepad or Apple TextEdit. However, opening HLB files with a text editor will not appear the same as opening them with OpenVMS.
